verses.Prov. 3:27: Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in your power to do it.

verses.Prov. 3:5: Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding.

verses.Prov. 10:4: A slack hand causes poverty, but the hand of the diligent makes rich.

verses.Prov. 10:20: The tongue of the righteous is choice silver; the heart of the wicked is of little worth.

verses.Prov. 11:24: One gives freely, yet grows all the richer; another withholds what he should give, and only suffers want.

verses.Prov. 12:1: Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge, but he who hates reproof is stupid.

verses.Prov. 14:15: The simple believes everything, but the prudent gives thought to his steps.

verses.Prov. 14:29: Whoever is slow to anger has great understanding, but he who has a hasty temper exalts folly.

verses.Prov. 8:33: Hear instruction and be wise, and do not neglect it.

verses.Prov. 9:8: Do not reprove a scoffer, or he will hate you; reprove a wise man, and he will love you.

verses.Prov. 9:10: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is insight.

verses.Prov. 9:12: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself; if you scoff, you alone will bear it.

verses.Prov. 10:9: Whoever walks in integrity walks securely, but he who makes his ways crooked will be found out.

verses.Prov. 11:12: Whoever belittles his neighbor lacks sense, but a man of understanding remains silent.

verses.Prov. 12:15: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but a wise man listens to advice.

verses.Prov. 13:20: Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise, but the companion of fools will suffer harm.

verses.Prov. 15:1: A soft answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

verses.Prov. 15:32: Whoever ignores instruction despises himself, but he who listens to reproof gains intelligence.
